thread.title: PREP FOOTBALL: Clinton improves to 7-0

author: Daily Telegram staff
title: PREP FOOTBALL: Clinton improves to 7-0
text: PREP FOOTBALL: Clinton improves to 7-0 Comment The Daily Telegram - Adrian, MI By Daily Telegram staff Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:00 PM By Daily Telegram staff Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:00 PM PETERSBURG The Clinton High School football team broke a 14-14 tie right before halftime, before exploding in the second half to defeat Tri-County Conference opponent Summerfield, 42-22, Friday night. Clinton took a 14-0 lead, before the Bulldogs knotted things back up. Clinton led 21-14 at halftime, before it shredded Summerfield’s defense in the second half. Mathew Sexton paced the Redskins (7-0, 5-0 TCC) attack, scoring four touchdowns on the ground and racking up 258 rushing yards. Sexton’s teammate Noah Poore found the end zone twice and totaled 138 yards rushing. Clinton allowed just eight points in the second hal. The Redskins had a third-down efficiency of 70 percent in the game (7-for-10), despite only passing twice. Clinton will look to remain unbeaten in Week 8, as it travels to TCC foe Britton Deerfield. Madison 40, Whitmore Lake 12: At Madison Twp., Madison racked up 466 yards on the ground in a convincing Tri-County Conference win against Whitmore Lake. With key players Connor Mellon and Donovan Slates sidelined due to injuries, Colby Weitenhagen filled the offensive gap, scoring three touchdowns and totaling 223 yards rushing. Chris Pharion filled duties behind center and added a 59-yard TD run among his 80 total yards rushing. Tyrell Love and David Miller also added scores for Madison (4-3, 3-2 TCC), while Love had 123 yards on the ground. Defensively, Madison allowed just 253 yards of total offense to Whitmore Lake, which failed to score outside of the second quarter. Madison will host Summerfield next week for a key TCC matchup. Adrian 40, Dexter 14: At Dexter, quarterback Joel Hill hooked up with wide receiver Mitchell Dempsey for four touchdowns, and Dempsey scored another on the ground in Adrian’s victory over Southeastern Conference opponent Dexter. The Maples (2-5, 1-4 SEC) earned their first conference victory of the season by dominanting in the trenches, totaling 304 yards on the ground. Caiden Welter led the rushing attack with 177 yards, while Dempsey found some seams in the secondary to rack up 129 receiving yards. Hill completed eight of his nine passing attempts for 142 yards. Adrian will look to continue its momentum next week when it hosts Monroe. Ypsilanti Lincoln 42, Tecumseh 41: At Tecumseh, a two-point conversion with 11 seconds remaining in the game sealed a heartbreaking loss for the Indians against SEC White Division foe Ypsilanti Lincoln. Mitch Meger scored a late touchdown to put the Indians (3-4, 3-2 SEC) up 41-34, but the Railsplitters struck with a late score and a two-point conversion to earn the win. Meger racked up 299 rushing yards with two scores, while the Indians also had two touchdowns on special teams: one a 73-yard kick return from Meger and the other a 70-yard punt return from Jordan Patterson. Defensively, Landon Pelham was all over the field, totaling 27 tackles (16 solo), while Will Sparrow added 13. Pelham also scored a touchdown after he recovered a fumble in the end zone. Page 2 of 3 - Tecumseh will look to bounce back at Bedford next week. Ida 35, Hudson 6: At Ida, it was a good fight from Hudson in a Lenawee County Athletic Association matchup, but the Tigers (3-4, 2-3 LCAA) had no answer for Ida’s star running back Eric Bugg, who ran for 229 yards and four touchdowns en route to a victory over Hudson. The Tigers held Ida scoreless in the first quarter, but couldnt stop Bugg from crossing in a goal line halfway through the second quarter. That score opened up the floodgates for Ida, as it scored twice more before Hudson could find the scoreboard in the third quarter. Jackson Patton found James Wallace on a 19-yard completion for the Tigers’ first and only touchdown of the night. Ida punched in two more scores before the final whistle blew. Hudson was lead offensively by Malik Ray, who ran for 62 yards, and Matt Osborne had 53. Patton, the Tigers’ quarterback, had 34 yards on four completions plus a touchdown pass. Defensively, Jarett Waters finished with 13 tackles, followed by Nick Feekings with 10. Hudson hosts Onsted next week. Grass Lake 50, Addison 20: At Addison, Addison could not contain Grass Lake’s prolific offense in a Cascades Conference matchup. Addison (2-5, 2-4 Cascades) trailed early following three straight scores from Grass Lake. The Panthers got on the board late in the second quarter when Brett Burris found Drew Rokita with a deep pass that resulted in a 60-yard touchdown. Grass Lake found the end zone again before the half, and at the intermission it was Grass Lake on top 29-8. The Warriors picked up where they left off, jumping to a 50-14 lead, before Addison could muster any offense in the second half. Quincy SeGraves scampered into the end zone with 48 seconds left in the game to make the final score 50-20. SeGraves had another big game for the Panthers with 112 yards on 21 attempts plus a score. Hunter Dart also contributed for Addison on the ground with 61 yards on 10 carries. Burris led Addison through the air with 135 yards on 6 of 9 passing, including the 60-yard touchdown toss. Receiving leaders were Drew Rokita, who had 99 yards and a score, as well as Isaac Skinner, who had one catch for 17 yards to go with his rushing touchdown. Addison next faces Cascades foe Hanover-Horton next week. Hillsdale 35, Blissfield 0: At Blissfield, the Royals were blanked by the Hornets in an LCAA matchup Friday night, knocking them to 0-7 overall (0-5 in the LCAA). Hillsdale broke open the scoring seven minutes into the first quarter. The Hornets continued to run the ball against the Royals with four of the scores coming on the ground, including a 51-yard run in the second quarter which made the score 14-0. Page 3 of 3 - Blissfield’s offense was stifled by the Hillsdale defense, as the Royals were held to 77 total offensive yards, all of which came on the ground. Harley McKelvey and Connor Duval both led the Royals with 22 rushing yards apiece. Quarterback Joe Jones also made an impact on the ground, scampering for 20 yards in the losing effort. Defensively the Royals were led by Caleb Bangerter, who had 8 1/2 tackles. Blissfield is back in action next week in another LCAAmatchup against Erie Mason. By Daily Telegram staff The Daily Telegram - Adrian, MI By Daily Telegram staff
